Here, you are checking the pointers. However, the types (i.e. that the casting happens) aren't checked. See this:
```c++
root [0] class A{} a; class B : public A {} b;
root [3] &a == &b
(bool) false
root [4] static_cast<A*>(&b) == &b
(bool) true
```
That's why I suggested the `static_assert`.
Ah okay, I thought this was implicitly done with the pointer comparison, but I checked now that it doesn't cover it because you can compare `A*` with `B*`. Now I brought in the static assert.
